page.title: 01PARWICH INTRODUCTION
page.content:
{ This block is situated about seven miles north of the town of Ashbourne in Derbyshire.
Included in this block are the villages of Alsop-en-le-Dale and Parwich. Parwich is the larger of the two.
Most of the landscape consists of limestone hill country with it's characteristic limestone buildings and walls. The land rises to about 1200 feet, which is dissected by a number of dry valleys called, locally, "dales". This is a rural area which is dominated by farms which practice animal farming.
The block lies within the Peak National Park.
